text: my name is mara i'm a mechanical field
engineer
i started my career in an amazon amzl
center so you would work in the loading
docks you would help with sorting
packages
it was four days 10 hour shifts
overnight i loved the amazon culture
right away i felt like i was a good fit
but i didn't feel like my skill set was
exactly
in the best position
so i did a little bit of research on my
own and then i applied and within a
couple weeks i got an interview and i
got to talk to someone who was actually
working as a field engineer he described
the role to me he asked me what i
thought about it and i thought it would
be a good fit when i first saw the data
center online i thought it was just
going to be a big room with a lot of
beeping machines and i thought it'd be
quiet it wasn't quiet at all i thought
it was maybe just one person like
checking a couple racks making sure
everything was deployed and working but
that was not the case
there's so many people there's so many
different teams interacting
i didn't think that was possible aws
provided all the training and support
that i needed you don't need to have
that technical background you don't have
to have i.t expertise
you'll get the on-the-job training
[Music]
a lot of it is
on-site in the field
learning what's going on in a data
center day-to-day so you you will learn
the technical skills that you need
while you're in the data center at
amazon and aws there's a ton of room to
grow they focus on my own career
development and there's always unique
opportunities for me to to grow and to
learn
aws is a dynamic
fast-paced environment and you're never
bored there's always something going on
there's room for learning there's room
